00060     public function init()
00061     {
00062         parent::init();
00063         
00064         //  Add our options
00065         $this->addOptions( self::getBaseOptions() );
00066

00068         $this->baseClass = 'CPSCodeTable';
00069         $this->templatePath = Yii::getPathOfAlias( 'pogostick.templates' );

00077     public function run( $arArgs )
00078     {
00079         //  Our base path...
00080         $_sBasePath = Yii::getPathOfAlias( 'application.models' );
00081         
00082         //  Process arguments...
00083         $arArgs = $this->processArguments( $arArgs );
00084         
00085         //  Check args...
00086         if ( ! ( $_sClassName = PS::o( $arArgs, 0, null ) ) )
00087         {
00088             echo "\033[1mError\033[0m: model class name is required.\n";
00089             echo $this->getHelp();
00090             return;
00091         }
00092 
00093         //  Get table name...
00094         $_sTableName = PS::o( $arArgs, 1, self::DDL_TABLE_NAME );
00095 
00096         //  Process the model name...
00097         if ( ! preg_match('/^[\w\.\-\*]*(.*?)$/', $_sClassName, $_arMatches ) )
00098         {
00099             echo "\033[1mError\033[0m: model class \"" . $_sClassName . "\" is invalid.\n";
00100             return;
00101         }
00102 
00103         //  Get database set up
00104         if ( ! $this->getDbConnection() )
00105             return;
00106 
00107         //  Without regular expressions
00108         if ( empty( $_arMatches[ 1 ] ) )
00109         {
00110             $this->generateClassNames( $this->schema );
00111             
00112             if ( ( $_iPos = strrpos( $_sClassName, '.' ) ) !== false )
00113             {
00114                 //  i.e. module.models.* becomes base=module.models, class=*
00115                 $_sBasePath = Yii::getPathOfAlias( substr( $_sClassName, 0, $_iPos ) );
00116                 $_sClassName = substr( $_sClassName, $_iPos + 1 );
00117             }
00118 
00119             //  Generate all models
00120             if ( $_sClassName == '*' ) 
00121                 $this->generateRelations();
00122             else
00123             {
00124                 $_sTableName = PS::nvl( $arArgs[ 1 ], $_sClassName );
00125                 $this->tables[ $_sTableName ] = $_sClassName;
00126                 $this->generateRelations();
00127                 $this->classes = array( $_sTableName => $_sClassName );
00128             }
00129         }
00130         else  // with regular expressions
00131         {
00132             echo "\033[1mError\033[0m: regular expressions not valid for this command.\n";
00133             return;
00134         }
00135 
00136         $this->displayParameters( 'Code Table Generator', array( 'Output Path' => $_sBasePath ) );
00137             
00138         if ( count( $this->classes ) > 1 )
00139         {
00140             $_i = 1;
00141             
00142             echo "\nModel classes matching your criteria:\n";
00143             echo "============================================================\n\n";
00144             
00145             foreach ( $this->classes as $_sTableName => $_sClassName )
00146                 echo "    " . ( $_i++ ) . ". " . $this->bold( $_sClassName ) . " ({$_sTableName})\n";
00147             
00148             $_sPrompt = "\nDo you want to generate these classes? [\033[1mY\033[0mes|\033[1mN\033[0mo] ";
00149             
00150             while ( $_sPrompt )
00151             {
00152                 echo "$_sPrompt";
00153                 
00154                 switch ( substr( strtolower( trim( fgets( STDIN ) ) ), 0, 1 ) )
00155                 {
00156                     case 'y':
00157                         //  We got the answer we want!
00158                         break 2;
00159                         
00160                     case 'n':
00161                     case 'q':
00162                         return;
00163                 }
00164             }
00165             
00166             echo "\n";
00167         }
00168 
00169         $_arParams = $_arFiles = array();
00170         $_arClasses = $this->classes;
00171         $_sModelTemplate = $this->templatePath . DIRECTORY_SEPARATOR . $this->templateName;
00172         
00173         foreach ( $this->classes as $_sTableName => $_sClassName )
00174         {
00175             $_sClassFile = $_sBasePath . DIRECTORY_SEPARATOR . $_sClassName . '.php';
00176             
00177             $_arParams[ $_sClassName . '.php' ] = array(
00178                 'source' => $_sModelTemplate,
00179                 'target' => $_sClassFile,
00180                 'callback' => array( $this, 'generateModel' ),
00181                 'params' => array( $_sClassName, $_sTableName, $this->baseClass, $this->databaseName ),
00182             );
00183 
00184             if ( strlen( $_sClassName ) > $this->colWidth ) $this->colWidth = strlen( $_sClassName );
00185         }
00186 
00187         //  Load them all up
00188         $_arParams = $this->copyFiles( $_arParams );
00189         
00190         echo $this->getResultDisplay( $_arParams, true, $_iGen );
00191 
00192         if ( $_iGen )
00193         {
00194             echo <<<EOD
00195 ============================================================
00196 
00197 If you have a '{$this->databaseName}' database connection, you 
00198 may test any generated models now with the following commands:
00199 
00200     \$_oModel = {$_sClassName}::model()->find();
00201     print_r( \$_oModel );
00202 
00203 EOD;
00204         }
00205     }

00214     public function generateModel( $sView, $arParams )
00215     {
00216         $_arRules = $_arLabels = $_arRelations = array();
00217         list( $_sClassName, $_sTableName, $_sBaseClass, $this->databaseName, $_sClassFile ) = $arParams;
00218         
00219         $_sContents = file_get_contents( $sView );
00220         
00221         if ( null !== ( $_oTable = $this->schema->getTable( $_sTableName ) ) )
00222         {
00223             $_arRequired = $_arIntegers = $_arNumerical = array();
00224             
00225             foreach ( $_oTable->columns as $_oColumn )
00226             {
00227                 $label = ucwords( trim( strtolower( str_replace( array( '-', '_' ), ' ', preg_replace( '/(?<![A-Z])[A-Z]/', ' \0', $_oColumn->name ) ) ) ) );
00228                 $label = preg_replace( '/\s+/', ' ', $label );
00229                 
00230                 if ( strcasecmp( substr( $label, -3 ),' id' ) === 0 ) $label = substr( $label, 0, -3 );
00231                 $_arLabels[ $_oColumn->name ] = $label;
00232                 
00233                 if ( $_oColumn->isPrimaryKey && $_oTable->sequenceName !== null || $_oColumn->isForeignKey )
00234                     continue;
00235                     
00236                 if ( ! $_oColumn->allowNull && $_oColumn->defaultValue === null ) $_arRequired[] = $_oColumn->name;
00237                 
00238                 switch ( $_oColumn->type )
00239                 {
00240                     case 'integer':
00241                         $_arIntegers[] = $_oColumn->name;
00242                         break;
00243                         
00244                     case 'double':
00245                         $_arNumerical[] = $_oColumn->name;
00246                         break;
00247                         
00248                     case 'string':
00249                         if ( $_oColumn->size > 0 )
00250                             $_arRules[] = "array( '{$_oColumn->name}', 'length', 'max' => {$_oColumn->size} )";
00251                          break;
00252                 }
00253             }
00254             
00255             if ( $_arRequired !== array() ) $_arRules[] = "array( '" . implode( ', ', $_arRequired ) . "', 'required' )";
00256             if ( $_arIntegers !== array() ) $_arRules[] = "array( '" . implode( ', ', $_arIntegers ) . "', 'numerical', 'integerOnly' => true )";
00257             if ( $_arNumerical !== array() ) $_arRules[] = "array( '" . implode( ', ', $_arNumerical ) . "', 'numerical' )";
00258 
00259             if ( isset( $this->relations[ $_sClassName ] ) && is_array( $this->relations[ $_sClassName ] ) )
00260                 $_arRelations = $this->relations[ $_sClassName ];
00261         }
00262         else
00263             $this->echoString( "The table \"{$_sTableName}\" cannot be accessed", 'Warning' );
00264 
00265         // fall back to default ones
00266         if ( ! is_file( $sView ) ) $sView = YII_PATH . '/cli/views/shell/model/' . basename( $sView );
00267         
00268         return $this->renderFile( $sView, 
00269             array(
00270                 'className' => $_sClassName,
00271                 'tableName' => $_sTableName,
00272                 'baseClass' => $_sBaseClass,
00273                 'dbToUse' => $this->databaseName,
00274                 'columns'=> PS::nvl( $_oTable->columns, array() ),
00275                 'rules' => $_arRules,
00276                 'labels' => $_arLabels,
00277                 'relations' => $_arRelations,
00278             ),
00279             true
00280         );
00281     }
00282     
00287     public function getHelp()
00288     {
00289         $_sName = $this->bold( $this->name );
00290         $_sOptions = $this->getDisplayOptions();
00291         
00292         return <<<EOD
00293 USAGE
00294     \033[1mpscodetable\033[0m <\033[1mclass-name\033[0m> [\033[1mtable-name\033[0m] [options]
00295     
00296 This command generates a code table and a model class for said table.
00297 
00298 PARAMETERS
00299  * class-name: required, model class name. By default, the generated
00300    model class file will be placed under the directory aliased as
00301    'application.models'. To override this default, specify the class
00302    name in terms of a path alias, e.g., 'application.somewhere.ClassName'.
00303 
00304    If the model class belongs to a module, it should be specified
00305    as 'ModuleID.models.ClassName'.
00306 
00307    If the class name ends with '*', then a model class will be generated
00308    for EVERY table in the database.
00309 
00310    If the class name contains a regular expression deliminated by slashes,
00311    then a model class will be generated for those tables whose name
00312    matches the regular expression. If the regular expression contains
00313    sub-patterns, the first sub-pattern will be used to generate the model
00314    class name.
00315 
00316  * table-name: optional, the associated database table name. If not given,
00317    it is assumed to be the model class name.
00318 
00319 OPTIONS
00320 
00321   -f, --force                  if the model class exists, you will be able to 
00322                                    optionally overwrite it.
00323                                    
00324   -d, --database               The database component to use. 
00325                                    Defaults to 'db'
00326                                    
00327   -b, --base-class             The base class to use for generated models. 
00328                                    Defaults to 'CPSCodeTableModel'
00329                                    
00330   -n, --template-name          The name of the template to use. 
00331                                    Defaults to 'model.php'
00332                                    
00333   -t, --template-path          The template path to use.
00334 
00335 {$_sOptions}
00336 EXAMPLES
00337  * Generates the Codes model:
00338         {$_sName} Codes
00339 
00340  * Generates the Post model using component db_posts:
00341         {$_sName} Post -d=db_posts
00342 
00343  * Generates the Post model which is associated with table 'posts':
00344         {$_sName} Post posts
00345 
00346  * Generates the Post model which should belong to module 'admin':
00347         {$_sName} admin.models.Post
00348 
00349  * Generates a model class for every table in the current database:
00350         {$_sName} *
00351 
00352  * Generates a model class for every table based on CSubClass:
00353         {$_sName} * -b=CSubClass
00354 
00355  * Same as above, but the model class files should be generated
00356    under 'protected/models2':
00357         {$_sName} application.models2.*
00358 
00359  * Generates a model class for every table whose name is prefixed
00360    with 'tbl_' in the current database. The model class will not
00361    contain the table prefix.
00362         {$_sName} /^tbl_(.*)$/
00363 
00364  * Same as above, but the model class files should be generated
00365    under 'protected/models2':
00366         {$_sName} application.models2./^tbl_(.*)$/
00367 
00368 EOD;
00369     }

00380     protected function getClassName( $sTable )
00381     {
00382         return PS::nvl( $this->tables[ $sTable ], $this->generateClassName( $sTable ) );
00383     }
00384     
00393     protected function isRelationTable( $oTable )
00394     {
00395         $_sPK = $oTable->primaryKey;
00396         
00397         return ( count( $_sPK ) === 2 // we want 2 columns
00398             && isset( $oTable->foreignKeys[ $_sPK[ 0 ] ], $oTable->foreignKeys[ $_sPK[ 1 ] ] )  // Both PKs there...
00399             && $oTable->foreignKeys[ $_sPK[ 0 ] ][ 0 ] !== $oTable->foreignKeys[ $_sPK[ 1 ]][ 0 ] ); // and the foreign keys point different tables
00400     }
00401 
00409     protected function generateRelations()
00410     {
00411         $_arRelations = $_arClasses = array();
00412         
00413         foreach ( $this->schema->getTables() as $_oTable )
00414         {
00415             $_sTableName = $_oTable->name;
00416 
00417             if ( $this->isRelationTable( $_oTable ) )
00418             {
00419                 $_arPK = $_oTable->primaryKey;
00420                 $_arFK = $_oTable->foreignKeys;
00421 
00422                 $_sTableParent = $_arFK[ $_arPK[ 1 ]][ 0 ];
00423                 $_sTableChild = $_arFK[ $_arPK[ 0 ]][ 0 ];
00424                 
00425                 $_sParentClassName = $this->getClassName( $_sTableParent );
00426                 $_sChildClassName = $this->getClassName( $_sTableChild );
00427 
00428                 $_sRelationName = $this->generateRelationName( $_sTableParent, $_sTableChild, true );
00429                 $_arRelations[ $_sParentClassName ][ $_sRelationName ] = "array( self::MANY_MANY, '$_sChildClassName', '$_sTableName( $_arPK[0], $_arPK[1] )' )";
00430 
00431                 $_sRelationName  =$this->generateRelationName( $_sTableChild, $_sTableParent, true );
00432                 $_arRelations[ $_sChildClassName ][ $_sRelationName ] = "array( self::MANY_MANY, '$_sParentClassName', '$_sTableName( $_arPK[0], $_arPK[1] )' )";
00433             }
00434             else
00435             {
00436                 $_arClasses[ $_sTableName ] = $_sClassName = $this->getClassName( $_sTableName );
00437                 
00438                 foreach ( $_oTable->foreignKeys as $_sFKName => $_arFKEntry )
00439                 {
00440                     //  Put table and key name in variables for easier reading
00441                     $_sParentTableName = $_arFKEntry[ 0 ]; // Table name that current fk references to
00442                     $_sParentTableKey = $_arFKEntry[ 1 ];   // Key in that table being referenced
00443                     $_sParentClassName = $this->getClassName( $_sParentTableName );
00444 
00445                     //  Add relation for this table
00446                     $_sRelationName = $this->generateRelationName( $_sTableName, $_sFKName, false );
00447                     $_arRelations[ $_sClassName ][ $_sRelationName ] = "array( self::BELONGS_TO, '$_sParentClassName', '$_sFKName' )";
00448 
00449                     //  Add relation for the referenced table
00450                     $_sRelationType = $_oTable->primaryKey === $_sFKName ? 'HAS_ONE' : 'HAS_MANY';
00451                     $_sRelationName = $this->generateRelationName( $_sParentTableName, $_sTableName, $_sRelationType === 'HAS_MANY' );
00452                     $_arRelations[ $_sParentClassName ][ $_sRelationName ] = "array( self::$_sRelationType, '$_sClassName', '$_sFKName' )";
00453                 }
00454             }
00455         }
00456         
00457         $this->relations = $_arRelations;
00458         $this->classes = $_arClasses;
00459     }
00460 
00467     protected function generateClassName( $sTable )
00468     {
00469         return str_replace( ' ', '',
00470             ucwords(
00471                 trim(
00472                     strtolower(
00473                         str_replace( array( '-', '_' ), ' ',
00474                             preg_replace( '/(?<![A-Z])[A-Z]/', ' \0', $sTable )
00475                         )
00476                     )
00477                 )
00478             )
00479         );
00480     }
00481 
00488     protected function generateClassNames( $oSchema, $sPattern = null )
00489     {
00490         $_arTables = array();
00491         
00492         foreach ( $oSchema->getTableNames() as $_sTableName )
00493         {
00494             if ( $sPattern === null ) 
00495                 $_arTables[ $_sTableName ] = $this->generateClassName( $_sTableName );
00496             else if ( preg_match( $sPattern, $_sTableName, $_arMatches ) )
00497             {
00498                 if ( count( $_arMatches ) > 1 && ! empty( $_arMatches[ 1 ] ) )
00499                     $_sClassName = $this->generateClassName( $_arMatches[ 1 ] );
00500                 else
00501                     $_sClassName = $this->generateClassName( $_arMatches[ 0 ] );
00502                     
00503                 $_arTables[ $_sTableName ] = PS::nvl( $_sClassName, $_sTableName );
00504             }
00505         }
00506         
00507         $this->tables = $_arTables;
00508     }
00509 
00517     protected function generateRelationName( $sTableName, $sFKName, $bMultiple )
00518     {
00519         if ( strcasecmp( substr( $sFKName, -2 ), 'id' ) === 0 && strcasecmp( $sFKName, 'id' ) )
00520             $_sRelationName = rtrim( substr( $sFKName, 0, -2 ), '_' );
00521         else
00522             $_sRelationName = $sFKName;
00523             
00524         $_sRelationName[ 0 ] = strtolower( $_sRelationName );
00525 
00526         $_sRawName = $_sRelationName;
00527         
00528         if ( $bMultiple ) $_sRelationName = $this->pluralize( $_sRelationName );
00529 
00530         $_oTable = $this->schema->getTable( $sTableName );
00531         
00532         $_i = 0;
00533         
00534         while ( isset( $_oTable->columns[ $_sRelationName ] ) )
00535             $_sRelationName = $_sRawName . ( $_i++ );
00536             
00537         return $_sRelationName;
00538     }
00539 
00545     private function getBaseOptions()
00546     {
00547         return(
00548             array(
00549                 'schema' => 'object',
00550                 'relations' => 'array',
00551                 'tables' => 'array',
00552                 'classes' => 'array',
00553             )
00554         );
00555     }
